result.execSummary:
The defendant Benjamin D. Schultz was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.03(2)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: Any other probation now serving.

miscConds.notes:
If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete an alcohol assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant is to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent. 

Maintain absolute sobriety.

If agent recommends, defendant must attend and successfully complete a drug assessment, and comply with any recommended treatment.  Defendant to execute any releases necessary for agent to verify compliance.

Defendant to be subject to random testing by his agent. 

Maintain absolute sobriety.

The defendant shall comply with any treatment, evaluations and/or programming as deemed appropriate by a risk and needs assessment and the probation agent.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions. 

Comply with all anger management and/or domestic violence counseling recommendations by your agent. 

141 days sentence credit, if revoked.

Court advised defendant of the DNA submission requirement.

You must submit to and successfully complete a mental health evaluation to determine appropriate programming commensurate with needs identified.  Must comply with all recommendations.  Defendant must sign any releases agent deems necessary to verify defendant's compliance with probation conditions.

Not to enter into any bars, taverns, liquor stores, liquor department of grocery stores, the bar areas of restaurants. Defendant may not possess or consume any alcohol, nor be anywhere alcohol is available for consumption on the premises where the defendant is located.
Defendant prohibited from possessing any firearms.

If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged or terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of any restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt. Must pay all costs of supervision and court ordered financial obligations during the term of probation.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Benjamin D. Schultz

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: Court questioned defendant on his understanding of the waiver of preliminary hearing.  He stated he/she understood.  Court found that the defendant knowingly and intelligently waived his right to have a preliminary hearing. Court finds probable cause.

1:36 PM  Attorney Gregory J. Jerabek in court for Benjamin D. Schultz.  Attorney Jeri Marsolek in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Benjamin D. Schultz in court.   22CF110 Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to Count 1. 22CF86 - Counts 2 & 3 defendant enters a plea of Guilty. 
Court reviewed the elements and potential penalties of the charge the defendant plead to.  He understood.   Court reviewed the plea questionnaire, constitutional rights and elements with the defendant. Felony warnings given.  He understood. Defense stipulated that there is a factual basis for the plea.   Court found that the defendant freely, voluntarily, knowingly and intelligently entered his plea and waived his constitutional rights.  Court found that a factual basis exists for the plea.  Found guilty of Child Abuse-Intentionally Cause Harm contrary to 948.03(2)(b), 2 Counts Bail Jumping-Felony contrary to 946.49(1)(b). Defendant exercised his right to allocution. 
22CF86 - Ct 1 DRI, remaining Counts DRI in 22CF54, 22CF62, 22CF66 and uncharged read ins. 

Joint recommendation: 5 yrs probation, maintain absolute sobriety, no bars, taverns liquor stores, no alcohol, AODA, random urinalysis testing, anger management counseling, complete mental health evaluation follow thru w/recommendations. Complete counseling and programming. 
Court adopts the joint recommendation: Withholds sentence, orders 5 years probation. Maintain absolute sobriety, no alcohol or bars, AODA and follow up, random testing, complete anger management and domestic abuse programming and counseling, complete a mental health evaluation, follow thru w/recommendations. Risk and needs assessment and follow through. CC. 141 days sentence credit. Firearm prohibition and voting ineligibility. 

22-05507 and 22-05531 Jackson county incident # DRI. 

The defendant is ORDERED  to report to the Jackson County Jail to submit the required DNA specimen today.
on Petition for Appointment of an Attorney
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Status conference on October 3, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
